Description: Creation of the Software Centre by the National Institute of Telecommunication in Rabat Technopark. It is specialized in R&D and innovation in information and communication technologies (ICT).
Objective(s): Develop R&D and innovation in ICT.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research (MENFPESRS;)|Ministry of Investment, Industry, Trade and Digital Economy (MIICEN;)|National Institute of Telecommunication (INPT;)|National School of Mechanics and Electricity (ENSEM;)
Theme area(s): Emerging trends in STI policy|Innovation in firms and innovative entrepreneurship|Public research system
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Digital transformation of firms|Non-competitive research funding
Target group type(s): Economic actors (individuals)|Research and education organisations|Researchers, students and teachers
Target group(s): Entrepreneurs|Established researchers|Higher education institutes|PhD students|Postdocs and other early-career researchers|Private research and development lab
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Criteria for funding: Research publications and outputs (excellence), Research impact, Student enrolment or attainment rates|Funding amount allocated for an average time-period of: 3 years or less|Funding includes a teaching component: Yes|Funding is attached to: National performance-based research assessment|Penalties and rewards associated to performance: None of the above|Performance-based element to the allocation: No

English name: R&D CENTRE SPECIALISED IN ICT AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
Description: It is a R&D Centre focusing on ICT and AI hosted by the National School of Mechanics and Electricity in Casablanca.
Objective(s): To boost R&D, innovation and technology transfer in ICT area.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research (MENFPESRS;)
Theme area(s): Emerging trends in STI policy|Innovation in firms and innovative entrepreneurship|Public research system
Theme(s): Artificial intelligence (AI)|Digital transformation of firms|Non-competitive research funding
Target group(s): Established researchers|PhD students|Undergraduate and master students
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Criteria for funding: Research impact, Research infrastructure, Commercialisation of research-generated intellectual property|Funding amount allocated for an average time-period of: 4-6 years|Funding includes a teaching component: Yes|Funding is attached to: Institutional performance contract|Penalties and rewards associated to performance: None of the above|Performance-based element to the allocation: No

Original name(s): Programme Al-Khawarizmi d'appui à la recherche dans le domaine de l’Intelligence Artificielle et ses Applications
Description: The Ministry of National Education, Vocational Training, Higher Education and Scientific Research (MENFPESRS) launched a thematic research program, in collaboration with the Ministry of Industry, Investment, Trade and the Digital Economy (MIICEN), the Digital Development Agency (ADD) and the National Center for Scientific and Technical Research (CNRST) on Artificial Intelligence, to pursue three main objectives:
Objective(s): To prepare human capital with the AI ​​skills that the country needs to develop a prosperous economy based on digital transformation and the knowledge economy.To support applied AI research aimed at improving the competitiveness of Moroccan companies.To promote the upgrading of an innovative productive fabric that can take advantage of the different socio-economic opportunities that AI offers both at national and international level.
Responsible organisation(s): Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research (MENFPESRS;)|Ministry of Investment, Industry, Trade and Digital Economy (MIICEN;)|Digital Development Agency (ADD;)|National Centre for Scientific and Technical Research (CNRST;)
Target group type(s): Economic actors (individuals)|Firms by size|Social groups especially emphasised
Target group(s): Civil society|Firms of any size|Labour force in general|SMEs
